title: Split appropriate DRCSim ROS plugins out of atlas_msgs

content.raw: With drcsim's new file structure I can't really make any sense of where to find what. Why is everything crammed into ``ros/atlas_msgs`` and some things aren't? Why are things like ``gazebo_ros_laser`` or ``VRCPlugin`` in ``ros/atlas_msgs`` ... I would expect atlas messages to be in this folder and not all the gazebo related plugins. ``VRCPlugin`` is neither ROS related nor is it an atlas message, but yet you find it in ``ros/atlas_msgs``. Other plugins like ``DRCFirehosePlugin`` on the other hand are in ``drcsim/plugins/`` instead of ``ros/atlas_msgs``. Why do those 3 plugins get to be in their own cozy plugins folder while all the other 20 plugins need to share a crammed ``ros/atlas_msgs`` with 2 actual atlas messages hidden between all the gazebo plugins (two .. that's 10% of what's in there)? And why is ``JointCommands`` even so privileged to get its own repository? OSRF needs an equal opportunity commissioner for plugins and messages. ;)
